segments.source_content: In the Kubernetes realm, {crd} is a proven solution for implementing custom resources. Chaos Mesh leverages CRDs for natural integration with the Kubernetes ecosystem.

translations.ja: Kubernetesの領域において、{crd}はカスタムリソースを実装するための実績あるソリューションです。Chaos MeshはCRDを活用し、Kubernetesエコシステムと自然に統合します。

segments.source_content: No special dependencies, Chaos Mesh can be easily deployed on Kubernetes clusters directly, including {minikube} and {kind}.

translations.ja: 特別な依存関係なしで、Chaos MeshはKubernetesクラスタ（{minikube}や{kind}を含む）に簡単にデプロイできます。

segments.source_content: Ability to perform chaos experiments in production environments without modifying the deployment logic of applications.

translations.ja: アプリケーションのデプロイロジックを変更することなく、本番環境でカオス実験を実行可能。

segments.source_content: Quickly create chaos experiments through the dashboard, allowing users to observe the experiment's state in real time and quickly roll back any injected failures.

translations.ja: ダッシュボードから迅速にカオス実験を作成でき、ユーザーは実験の状態をリアルタイムで観察し、注入された障害を素早くロールバックできます。

segments.source_content: Chaos Mesh provides multiple filtering rules that allow selecting injection targets based on labels, annotations, and so on. They are collectively called selectors.

translations.ja: Chaos Meshは、ラベルやアノテーションなどに基づいて注入ターゲットを選択できる複数のフィルタリングルールを提供します。これらはセレクターとして総称されます。

segments.source_content: In addition, users can also set a namespace whitelist to greater control the "blast radius" of the experiment.

translations.ja: さらに、ユーザーはネームスペースのホワイトリストを設定することで、実験の「影響範囲」をより細かく制御できます。

segments.source_content: Role-based access control (RBAC) is enabled by default to restrict malicious operations. Users must be authorized with specific privileges to access the dashboard.

translations.ja: 悪意のある操作を制限するため、デフォルトでロールベースのアクセス制御（RBAC）が有効化されています。ユーザーはダッシュボードにアクセスするために特定の権限を付与される必要があります。

segments.source_content: Chaos Mesh brings various types of fault simulation to Kubernetes and has an enormous capability to orchestrate fault scenarios. It helps you conveniently simulate various abnormalities that might occur in reality during the development, testing, and production environments and find potential problems in the system.

translations.ja: Chaos MeshはKubernetesに多様な障害シミュレーションをもたらし、障害シナリオをオーケストレーションする巨大な能力を備えています。開発、テスト、本番環境で現実に発生しうる様々な異常を手軽にシミュレートし、システムの潜在的な問題を発見するのに役立ちます。

segments.source_content: Try it out with the following command 👇

translations.ja: 以下のコマンドで試してみましょう 👇

segments.source_content: Based on the principles of Chaos Engineering, Chaos Mesh abstracts real-world events into objects that can be directly applied, hiding the trivial details.

translations.ja: Chaos Engineeringの原則に基づき、Chaos Meshは現実世界のイベントを直接適用可能なオブジェクトとして抽象化し、瑣末な詳細を隠蔽します。

segments.source_content: Chaos Mesh initially started from a distributed system perspective, fully considering its possible failures, thus providing more comprehensive and fine-grained fault types to help users with fault injection for networks, disks, file systems, operating systems, etc.

translations.ja: Chaos Meshは当初から分散システムの視点で設計され、発生しうるあらゆる障害を考慮しています。これにより、ネットワーク、ディスク、ファイルシステム、OSなどに対するより包括的で細かい障害タイプを提供し、ユーザーの障害注入を支援します。

segments.source_content: Real-world failures are often not isolated causes.Chaos Mesh has built-in workflows that allow you to experiment serially or in parallel at will to build walkthroughs that fit the architecture.

translations.ja: 現実世界の障害は単一の原因で発生することは稀です。Chaos Meshには組み込みのワークフロー機能があり、直列または並列で自由に実験を行い、アーキテクチャに適合するシナリオを構築できます。

segments.source_content: You can also use the suspend node to simulate a temporary recovery.

translations.ja: 一時停止ノードを使用して、一時的な回復をシミュレートすることも可能です。

segments.source_content: You can also use customized status checks to inform the cluster status.

translations.ja: カスタマイズしたステータスチェックを使用して、クラスターの状態を通知することもできます。

segments.source_content: Even if you are not using Kubernetes, you can still take advantage of the features of Chaos Mesh. One of our experimental tools, Chaosd, specifically tests chaos on physical machines. Moreover, you can use {link} in Chaos Mesh to remotely invoke Chaosd for conducting experiments on physical machines.

translations.ja: Kubernetesを使用していない場合でも、Chaos Meshの機能を活用できます。実験的ツールの1つであるChaosdは、物理マシン上でカオステストを実行するために特別に設計されています。さらに、Chaos Mesh内の{link}を使用して、物理マシン上で実験を行うためにChaosdをリモートで呼び出すことも可能です。

segments.source_content: Join the community and interact with maintainers and other users. Your suggestions can make Chaos Mesh better.

translations.ja: コミュニティに参加し、メンテナーや他のユーザーと交流しましょう。あなたの提案がChaos Meshをより良いものにします。

segments.source_content: Be a contributor to building the future of Chaos Mesh.

translations.ja: Chaos Meshの未来を共に築く貢献者になりましょう。

segments.source_content: Experiencing any issues? Don't hesitate to reach out to us for assistance.

translations.ja: 問題が発生しましたか？遠慮なく私たちに連絡してサポートを受けてください。

segments.source_content: Connect with other users on our Slack channel (#project-chaos-mesh).

translations.ja: Slackチャンネル（#project-chaos-mesh）で他のユーザーとつながりましょう。
このページはクラッシュしました。

home.features.k8s.desc.message: In the Kubernetes realm, {crd} is a proven solution for implementing custom resources. Chaos Mesh leverages CRDs for natural integration with the Kubernetes ecosystem.

home.features.easytouse.desc.message: No special dependencies, Chaos Mesh can be easily deployed on Kubernetes clusters directly, including {minikube} and {kind}.

home.features.easytouse.list.1.message: Ability to perform chaos experiments in production environments without modifying the deployment logic of applications.

home.features.easytouse.list.2.message: Quickly create chaos experiments through the dashboard, allowing users to observe the experiment's state in real time and quickly roll back any injected failures.

home.features.flexiblescope.desc.1.message: Chaos Mesh provides multiple filtering rules that allow selecting injection targets based on labels, annotations, and so on. They are collectively called selectors.

home.features.flexiblescope.desc.2.message: In addition, users can also set a namespace whitelist to greater control the "blast radius" of the experiment.

home.features.securityfirst.desc.message: Role-based access control (RBAC) is enabled by default to restrict malicious operations. Users must be authorized with specific privileges to access the dashboard.

home.desc.message: Chaos Mesh brings various types of fault simulation to Kubernetes and has an enormous capability to orchestrate fault scenarios. It helps you conveniently simulate various abnormalities that might occur in reality during the development, testing, and production environments and find potential problems in the system.

home.tryitout.message: Try it out with the following command 👇

home.features.desc.message: Based on the principles of Chaos Engineering, Chaos Mesh abstracts real-world events into objects that can be directly applied, hiding the trivial details.

home.failuretypes.desc.message: Chaos Mesh initially started from a distributed system perspective, fully considering its possible failures, thus providing more comprehensive and fine-grained fault types to help users with fault injection for networks, disks, file systems, operating systems, etc.

home.workflows.desc.message: Real-world failures are often not isolated causes.Chaos Mesh has built-in workflows that allow you to experiment serially or in parallel at will to build walkthroughs that fit the architecture.

home.workflows.suspend.desc.message: You can also use the suspend node to simulate a temporary recovery.

home.workflows.statuscheck.desc.message: You can also use customized status checks to inform the cluster status.

home.chaosd.desc.message: Even if you are not using Kubernetes, you can still take advantage of the features of Chaos Mesh. One of our experimental tools, Chaosd, specifically tests chaos on physical machines. Moreover, you can use {link} in Chaos Mesh to remotely invoke Chaosd for conducting experiments on physical machines.

home.buildcommunity.desc.message: Join the community and interact with maintainers and other users. Your suggestions can make Chaos Mesh better.

home.buildcommunity.beacontributor.message: Be a contributor to building the future of Chaos Mesh.

home.buildcommunity.help.message: Experiencing any issues? Don't hesitate to reach out to us for assistance.

home.buildcommunity.slack.message: Connect with other users on our Slack channel (#project-chaos-mesh).
